title: Govt to end colonial legacy of `pomp and glory’ protocol culture: PM
content:
ISLAMABAD, July 6 (APP): Prime Minister Imran Khan Tuesday indicating to review the protocol and security for ministers, governors and chief ministers said the government will put an end to the colonial legacy of pomp and glory.
Next week Cabinet will decide on a comprehensive policy in this regard. We will put an end to the colonial legacy of pomp & glory used to overwhelm the people.
— Imran Khan (@ImranKhanPTI) July 6, 2021
“Next week Cabinet will decide on a comprehensive policy in this regard,” the Prime Minister said in a tweet posted on his social media account.
The Prime Minister said in order to save taxpayer money and avoid inconvenience to the public he will not be going to any private function with protocol and security.
“I am also reviewing protocol & security for ministers, governors & PTI CMs   to decide how we can minimize expenditure & end public inconvenience,” he said, adding, “We will put an end to the colonial legacy of pomp and glory used to overwhelm the people.”
